description: Near-flat D11 second moment analysis for R(B_{n-1}, B_n) = 4n-1
method_p31: D12 random sampling (500K per orbit rep)
method_p43: SA search (80K iters x 2 trials per orbit rep, subsample of NF-only)

aflat.comment: 6 of 22 orbits have N>0; ratio ~6.9 consistent with previous data

near_flat_only.comment: Only 1 of 106 NF-only orbits found working; high ratio

combined_near_flat.comment: Expanding from A-flat to near-flat dilutes ratio from 6.9 to 32.7

aflat.comment: 5 of 168 A-flat orbits have SA-found valid D12 (all max_A=11). CONTRADICTS earlier claim that A-flat N=0 at p=43.

near_flat_only.comment: SA found known D11 orbit; other 99 NF-only orbits in sample did not yield. p_working ~1%.

combined_near_flat.comment: ~23 working orbits out of 2015 near-flat. SA is a lower bound (may miss solutions).

key_findings: 1. A-flat D11 DO have valid D12 at p=43 (5/168 orbits working via SA), contradicting earlier belief.
2. At p=31, near-flat-only class has much higher ratio (106) than A-flat (6.86). Combined: 32.67.
3. At p=43, p_working is lower but still positive for both A-flat (3%) and NF-only (1%).
4. The known p=43 solution is near-flat-only (max_A=12), confirming near-flat is the right class.
5. SA lower bounds on p_working suggest Omega(1/p) or better fraction of orbits are working.
